This bug is reproducable on Linux-GTK only (not on Windows) and only with the 
exact steps given. The issue is trivial since the NPE is only logged, and only under very specific conditions, user experience is otherwise not affected.

1. Launch Eclipse
2. Window > Show View > Other > PDE Runtime > PDE Error Log
3. Window > Customize Perspective > Submenus:Show View
   --> Add "Terminal" as a Show View Shortcut
4. Window > Show View > Terminal
5. Close the Terminal by pressing the View's X button
6. Press the "Add fastview" buttom on the bottom left of the Eclipse screen
7. Choose the Terminal
8. Click into any other location in the screen, e.g. caption of the error log

--> Observe following NPE reported as "Unhandled event loop exception".
This might be an Eclipse problem, because it looks like "focusLost()" is called on the Terminal's focus handler before it receives "focusGained()". The bug might actually be that when a view is restored as FastView from a View Shortcut, focusGained() is never called.
